title: Everything about Soraka top is the most efficient definition of why Top lane is horrible
body:
She's ranged vs most melees.

She is 100% relevant throughout the game, regardless of how her laning phase goes, simply because her heals and silences will never ever fall off.

She can bully out melee's because of said range, allowing her to actually be a very dominant lane bully vs most top laners.

And even if she gets beaten into the ground, it absolutely doesn't matter because once the laning phase is over, you might as well set those deaths back to zero.

She doesn't need TP because of her ultimate and redemption, allowing her to stay toplane and not miss farm, and once she gets max CDR, she'll easily be able to just chill up top lane.

Is this Soraka's fault? Is Soraka broken? Is she this unstoppable force that needs to be gutted? Even if you hit her numbers a bit. Even if you reduce her power in lane, it's still very possible that she could still remain topside. Because top lane is a terrible lane that (and I'm speaking in the most generalizing way possible) is the least relevant lane of everything.

If you're going 5/1 on a Garen and you're crushing it top... but the enemy adc/mid/jungle are going 6/0, it's absolutely not going to matter.

Instead of trying to put a bandaid on things by nerfing Soraka (and probably making her useless afterwards) the changes needs to be on top lane as a whole.

This is correct. Soraka top isn't being played because she can outsustain bruisers. Anyone who says this is what we call... Bronze. A phase Rush Darius can DELETE her before she can even react.

She's being played top because even if she's jungle camped for 15 minutes, she's always going to provide for her team. Maybe I'm just low elo, but Soraka top is GREAT for me as a Darius main. Even if she plays SUPER passive, to the point neither of us has KP against each other, that's fine. I'll just have 200 CS by 20 minutes while she'll have 75.

But in OPs defense, Soraka has BS healing as of now. Needs to be toned down.

Oh, your ultimate decapitates my teammates? That's fineeeeee. Heal up.

From my point of view the issue isn't that her healing needs to be toned down, nerfs aren't going to fix the issue. nerfing Soraka may prevent her from being played top but it'll also stop her from being played at all, and then another champion will show up top lane that exhibits the same issue.

Soraka top right now has a lot of cheesy damage and sustain that takes top laners by surprise. I played against her as Darius before all the hype, and a well timed barrier spelled my death under tower, learning from my mistake by the end of the game she had less than 100 cs and I had above 200, but she was still very effective outside of lane, and single handily won a teamfight on her own because of her dependable healing and sustain. what does this all come down to? Impact. Top Lane impact. 

Soraka Top is just another flavor of the month pick, and her WR will dip if left alone as people learn to respect her sustain and ult, but this shows us that having a 3rd damage threat, a tank, or a split pushing top isn't nearly as impactful as an additional supportive champion that can keep teammates alive and disrupt the flow of a teamfight for the enemy. So we should really look at Soraka top and learn why she is so successful to fix the issue, because currently her lack of damage doesnt negatively affect her team. Does this mean that bruisers are weak? That mages are too strong? that supports are overloaded in response to kits in the game? Or maybe that traditional top lane items are too weak and gold inefficient?

Bruisers are my favorite class of champions, and I believe that having bruisers in the game allows for a fun and interesting experience for everyone, I've had a lot of fun playing against sett and have had moments where i want to tear my hair out playing against soraka. I think buffing certain advanced items and corresponding finished items would lead to stronger laning phases for traditional melee tops that can transition to stronger team fight impact that will discourage enchanters and glass cannon control mages from going top. At least that's my hope for this solution.

I don't agree that top lane should be an island, you can't be isolated from the rest of the map and have impact at the same time.

That said, "TP bot lane and get free double kills all day", don't make me laugh. It's rare you can get a double kill like that, and a TP from top is risky in general because if ANYTHING goes wrong, you are screwed (at best you give a lead to the enemy toplaner, at worst you get killed). And then you gotta wait 6 minutes before having tp again. Not to mention you can't cancel the tp anymore...

Mid can easily roam bot again and again while top has to wait for the TP cd.. And mid is also 2 levels ahead of jungle and bot, which is broken. Mid is the most impactful role right now, and since it can have so much map pressure it didn't deserve the exp buffs. If bot is lvl 5, mid should be level 6 like in previous seasons (unless very fed) while top lane gets to be level 7 as compensation for not having an impact on the map (at least until Riot does something to fix that).
